title: Understanding Atomic Emission
text: Atomic emission spectroscopy relies on the principle that atoms emit light when they transition from a higher energy state to a lower one. This emitted light is characteristic of the element.

title: Energy States and Emission
text: When atoms absorb energy, they move to an excited state. As they return to their ground state, they emit light at specific wavelengths.

hintAnswer: Excited atoms returning to lower energy states
title: Identifying the Cause of Emission
text: What happens to atoms that causes them to emit light in atomic emission spectroscopy?
choices: Excited atoms returning to lower energy states
Atoms absorbing energy from a light source
Atoms being ionized by an electric field

title: Analyzing the Emission Spectrum
text: Each element emits light at specific wavelengths, creating a unique emission spectrum. This spectrum can be used to identify the elements present in a sample.

title: Practical Applications
text: Atomic emission spectroscopy is widely used in fields such as environmental analysis, metallurgy, and pharmaceuticals to determine the composition of samples.
